theoryTitle: Rayleigh's Protective Instinct Toward Enslaved Girls
theoryText: Some fans theorize that Rayleigh's decision to intervene and protect Camie using his Conqueror's Haki may have been influenced by his history with the Boa sisters (Hancock, Sandersonia, and Marigold). The theory suggests that Rayleigh knew about or encountered the enslaved Boa sisters during their captivity and has since developed a particular soft spot for young girls trapped in the slave trade. This would explain why he breaks his usual passive approach (simply stealing from buyers) to actively protect Camie, describing himself as 'an old man who cannot ignore a pretty girl.'
evidenceFor: Rayleigh's unusual intervention to protect Camie despite his usual passive approach
His specific mention of being unable to ignore a 'pretty girl'
His later revealed connection to Amazon Lily and the Kuja
His protective nature shown throughout the arc
evidenceAgainst: No direct confirmation in the manga or anime
Could simply be Rayleigh's general good nature
The timeline of when Rayleigh might have known about the Boa sisters is unclear

theoryTitle: Rayleigh's Deliberate Positioning at the Auction
theoryText: Rather than being randomly captured, some fans theorize that Rayleigh deliberately positioned himself at this specific auction house at this specific time. The theory suggests he may have had foreknowledge that something significant would happen, possibly through his advanced Observation Haki or connections to the underworld. This would explain why the legendary 'Dark King' was so conveniently present when the Straw Hats needed help most.
evidenceFor: Rayleigh's calm demeanor suggesting he was in control the entire time
The convenient timing of his presence when Luffy needed guidance
His advanced Haki abilities could have given him foreknowledge
Later revealed that he wanted to meet Luffy
evidenceAgainst: Rayleigh himself states he lets himself be sold regularly to steal from buyers
No indication in the story that he knew the Straw Hats would be there
Occam's Razor suggests it was simply coincidence

theoryText: Eustass Kid's statement that 'compared to them [Celestial Dragons], the villains of the world seems much more honorable' has led fans to theorize that this establishes a moral code that could eventually lead to an alliance with Luffy. The theory suggests that despite being rivals, Kid and Luffy share a fundamental sense of honor that opposes the corrupt World Government, potentially setting up a future alliance against common enemies.
evidenceFor: Kid's moral observation about the Celestial Dragons
Both Kid and Luffy show contempt for the World Nobles
Kid helps indirectly during the auction house chaos
Later story developments show Kid's complex morality
evidenceAgainst: Kid is established as a rival rather than ally
Kid's methods are more brutal than Luffy's
Their goals and philosophies differ significantly
